intro: Prunus avium, commonly known as the European cherry, is a deciduous tree native to southwest Asia and southern Europe. It produces sweet, red to dark red fruits that are widely used in culinary and commercial applications. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces white or pink flowers in early spring. Its botanical classification includes the genus Prunus, which also includes peaches, plums, and cherries. The tree typically grows to a height of 6–10 meters and thrives in well-drained soils.
